title: Understanding Mental Disorders in Primary Care: Mobile Microlearning Course for Large-Scale Implementation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical terminology and introductory-level understanding of psychology
context.additional_context: Students learn accessibly via personal mobile devices, emphasizing diagnostic interview skills and patient communication competencies linked to the language domain.

learning_goals: Distinguish key symptoms of the five major mental disorders (depressive disorder, anxiety disorder, schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, PTSD) commonly encountered in primary care settings.
Utilize basic screening tools (PHQ-9, GAD-7, etc.) to assess risk levels for patients presenting with mental health concerns.
Interpret mental health education materials considering cultural contexts to construct patient-tailored explanations
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
